oai_dc:dc.dc:title: William Walker historic marker, Nashville, Tennessee, 1978 July
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An historic marker for William Walker, “The Grey-Eyed Man of Destiny,” that reads: “Born May 8, 1824, Walker moved to this site from 6th Ave. N. in 1840. In early life he was doctor, lawyer & journalist. He invaded Mexico in 1853 with 46 men & proclaimed himself Pres., Republic of Lower Calif. Led force into Nicaragua in 1855; was elected its Pres. In 1856. In attempt to wage war on Honduras was captured & executed Sept. 12, 1860.” This marker is found at 4th Ave. N. and Commerce St. in downtown Nashville. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Walker, William, 1824-1860
